overview: Tax credits for childcare costs while you work - eligibility, how much you get, childcare vouchers and working out your costs
title: Childcare and tax credits

table.body:
You can get extra tax credits to help pay for some of your childcare costs while you're working. 

You can get:  

+ up to £122.50 a week - for 1 child 
+ up to £210 a week - for 2 children or more

You can't get 100% of the costs and how much you get depends on things like: 

+ your income 
+ how often and for how long you've paid for childcare

##Childcare vouchers 

If you get childcare vouchers from your employer the amount of tax credit you get can go down. 

^Use the [childcare calculator](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/calcs/ccin.htm "Childcare - better off calculator"){:rel="external"} to see how childcare vouchers from your employer affects your tax credits.^
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
To qualify:

+ you must [qualify for Working Tax Credit](/working-tax-credit "Working Tax Credit") 
+ the 'carer' must be registered or approved
+ you can't be a foster parent claiming costs for your own foster child 

The carer can be a childminder, playscheme, nursery or club etc. The care can be provided at home, school or another place. 

##Qualifying care

To qualify, the carer must have a registration or approval number (they should be able to give you this). 

###Exception - foster carers 

A foster carer doesn't need a registration or approval number if the care is outside the child's home and the child is: 

+ aged 8 to 16 (Wales only)
+ aged 12 to 16 (Northern Ireland only)

###Schools 

Usually, the care must be outside of school hours and on the school's premises. 

###Relatives or partners

Usually, you can't claim for childcare provided by a relative or partner (even if they're registered). Check with the Tax Credit Office.
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
If you're new to tax credits, contact the Tax Credit Helpline for a claim form. It takes up to 2 weeks to arrive. 

If you’re already claiming tax credits you don't need a claim form - just call the Tax Credit Helpline to update your claim.

$C
**Tax Credit Helpline**  
**Telephone:** 0345 300 3900  
**Textphone:** 0345 300 3909
$C

##What you need to know

You can claim at any time of the year and up to 7 days before you start using childcare. 

You can't claim online or download a claim form. 

To support your claim, keep records about the carer's registration and the money you pay them (eg receipts or invoices). 

[Report any changes](/changes-that-affect-your-tax-credits "Changes that affect your tax credits") to your childcare because they can affect how much money you get. For example, if you start paying more for your childcare.
